Melbourne.description: A two-week Grand Slam tennis tournament featuring the world's top players, accompanied by various entertainment options including live music and family-friendly activities.
One of the world's largest comedy festivals, showcasing stand-up, cabaret, theatre, and street performances across numerous city venues.
Established in 1952, MIFF presents a diverse selection of Australian and international films, including features, documentaries, and shorts.
An open-access arts festival featuring a wide array of art forms such as theatre, comedy, music, and digital art across various venues.

Australia's largest free community festival, celebrated over four days during the Labour Day long weekend, including a parade, live music, fireworks, and the famous Birdman Rally along the Yarra River.
A dusk-to-dawn arts and cultural festival transforming the city with light installations, projections, music, and performances.
A celebration of Victoria's culinary scene, featuring food and wine events, masterclasses, and dining experiences.

Sydney.eventName: Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras
Sydney.description: One of the largest LGBTQ+ festivals globally, featuring a vibrant parade, parties, and cultural events celebrating diversity and inclusion.
An annual festival of light, music, and ideas, transforming the city with mesmerizing light installations and projections.
A major arts festival presenting a diverse program of theatre, dance, music, and visual arts across the city.
An outdoor sculpture exhibition along the Bondi to Tamarama coastal walk, showcasing works by Australian and international artists.
An annual literary festival featuring talks, panel discussions, and workshops with acclaimed authors and thinkers.
One of the longest-running film festivals in the world, showcasing a diverse selection of local and international films.

Auckland.description: The largest Pacific Islands-themed festival globally, celebrating the diverse cultures of the Pacific with traditional cuisine, performances, and arts.
A biennial multi-arts festival showcasing local and international artists in theatre, dance, music, and visual arts.
An annual event bringing together international and local writers for discussions, readings, and workshops.
A vibrant celebration of Indian culture and the Hindu festival of Diwali, featuring performances, food stalls, and traditional activities.

Brisbane.description: A major international arts festival featuring theatre, music, dance, and visual arts, culminating in the Riverfire fireworks display.
A rugby league extravaganza where all NRL matches for the round are played at Suncorp Stadium, attracting fans nationwide.
Showcasing a curated selection of films from around the world, including premieres and special events.
A month-long comedy festival featuring local and international comedians in stand-up, sketch, and improv performances.
An annual literary festival celebrating books, writing, and ideas with author talks, panel discussions, and workshops.
Showcasing the best cinema from the Asia Pacific region, including features, documentaries, and short films.

Perth.description: Australia's longest-running cultural festival, offering a diverse program of music, theatre, dance, literature, and visual arts.
One of the largest fringe festivals globally, featuring a vast array of performances including comedy, cabaret, theatre, and street arts.
An annual outdoor sculpture exhibition along Cottesloe Beach, showcasing works from Australian and international artists.
A showcase of independent cinema, featuring a diverse selection of films, documentaries, and short films.
A month-long comedy festival featuring local and international comedians in stand-up, sketch, and improv performances.

Adelaide.description: A premier arts festival offering a rich program of theatre, music, dance, and visual arts from renowned international and local artists.
The largest open-access arts festival in the Southern Hemisphere, featuring thousands of performances across various genres and venues.
South Australia's largest visual arts festival, showcasing the work of local artists in exhibitions, workshops, and events.
A celebration of Asian arts and culture, featuring performances, exhibitions, and events from across the region.
Showcasing a diverse selection of Australian and international films, including features, documentaries, and shorts.
An annual literary festival featuring talks, panel discussions, and readings by acclaimed authors and thinkers.

Wellington.eventName: New Zealand Festival of the Arts
Wellington.description: The nation's largest celebration of contemporary arts and culture, featuring a diverse range of performances and exhibitions across various venues in Wellington.
A five-day festival showcasing local and international jazz musicians in concerts, workshops, and community events.
A culinary festival celebrating the city's food and beverage industry with special menus, events, and culinary experiences.
A vibrant street festival in Wellington's Cuba Street, featuring music, dance, street performers, and food stalls.
A celebration of Pacific Island culture with traditional performances, food stalls, and arts and crafts.
